Step-by-Step: Setup Custom Email (23 Minutes)

1

Purchase Your Domain (5 min)

Buy from Namecheap, Google Domains, or your AI builder. If you buy through the builder, domain setup is automated. If you buy separately, you'll configure DNS manually.

2

Purchase Google Workspace (3 min)

Go to workspace.google.com, choose "Business Starter" ($6/month). Enter your domain. Google will verify ownership (HTML file upload or DNS record).

3

Update MX Records (5 min)

Google provides MX records. Copy them to your domain's DNS settings. Your domain registrar (Namecheap, GoDaddy) has a DNS management panel. Paste the records there.

4

Wait for DNS Propagation (5-30 min)

DNS updates take time. 48 hours is the official max, but 5-30 minutes is realistic in 2026. Google will verify automatically when propagation completes.

5

Connect to Your AI Builder (5 min)

In your AI builder's settings, find "Email" or "Integrations." Some auto-detect Google Workspace. Others require manual verification. Framer, Durable, 10Web all auto-detect.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do AI website builders include free custom email?

No. Every AI website builder charges extra for custom email. The industry standard: Google Workspace at $6-12/month. Some builders include forwarding (free@yourdomain.com ‚Üí your@gmail.com), but that's not professional email.

What's the difference between email forwarding and professional email?

Forwarding: emails sent to you@yourdomain.com redirect to your personal Gmail. You reply from your personal address. Professional email: you@yourdomain.com is your actual inbox. You send AND receive from your business address. Forwarding looks amateur. Professional email builds trust.

Can I use any email provider with AI website builders?

Mostly yes. Google Workspace works with all AI builders. Microsoft 365 works with most. Other providers (ProtonMail, Zoho Mail) require manual DNS setup but work technically. The challenge: integration quality varies. Google Workspace just works everywhere.

How long does email setup take?

5 minutes if you know what you're doing. 2 hours if you're configuring DNS for the first time. The bottleneck: DNS propagation (up to 48 hours, usually 5-30 minutes). I've set up custom email on 13 sites - average time: 23 minutes including DNS propagation wait.

Should I buy email through my AI website builder or directly?

Buy directly from Google or Microsoft. Builder markup averages 20%. Same Google Workspace, higher price. Exception: Some builders include email free for the first year. Calculate: (builder annual cost) vs (Google Workspace annual cost). Usually direct is cheaper long-term.

What if I switch AI website builders later?

Your email stays with your domain, not the builder. Switch builders, update DNS records, email keeps working. I've migrated 4 sites between builders - zero email downtime. Email independence is a key reason to use Google Workspace instead of builder-specific email.

Do I need technical skills to set up custom email?

Basic DNS knowledge helps, but most builders provide copy-paste instructions. The technical part: updating MX records, SPF records, DKIM. If you can edit a text file and follow a tutorial, you can set up custom email. First time: allocate an hour. After that: 15 minutes.

PLATFORM-BY-PLATFORM EMAIL FEATURES

1. Squarespace - Google Workspace Integration

Email included: Yes (free for first year, then $6-24/month depending on plan)
Provider: Google Workspace (Gmail with your domain)
Setup: Purchased through Squarespace, one-click setup
Features: Professional Gmail, 30GB storage, collaborative tools

üí° Pro tip: Squarespace's Google Workspace integration is excellent. You get professional Gmail interface (everyone knows how to use), spam filtering, mobile apps. First year free with annual Squarespace plan - great value.

2. Wix - Google Workspace & Microsoft 365

Email included: Yes (add-on, $4-8/month depending on provider)
Providers: Google Workspace or Microsoft 365 (Outlook)
Setup: Purchased through Wix, relatively simple setup
Features: Choice of Gmail or Outlook, professional interface

üí° Pro tip: Wix gives you choice between Google Workspace and Microsoft 365. Choose Google if you prefer Gmail interface (most people do). Choose Microsoft 365 if you're already in Outlook/Office ecosystem. Both work well.

3. Shopify - Professional Email Included

Email included: Yes (unlimited forwardings, @myshopify.com optional)
Provider: Built-in email forwarding, or integrate Google Workspace
Setup: Simple - forward to existing email, or buy through Shopify
Features: Forwarding free, paid email with G Suite integration

üí° Pro tip: Shopify's email forwarding is free - you@yourstore.com forwards to your existing Gmail/Outlook. This is fine for many e-commerce stores. For branded email inbox, integrate Google Workspace through Shopify ($6/month extra).

4. Webflow - Bring Your Own Email

Email included: No (you provide your own email service)
Providers: Any - Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, Zoho Mail, more
Setup: Purchase email separately, connect to Webflow domain
Features: Maximum flexibility, choose provider that fits your needs

üí° Pro tip: Webflow doesn't sell email - you buy elsewhere and connect. Google Workspace ($6/month) is most common. For budget option, Zoho Mail ($1-2/month) works great. Webflow just handles the domain, you handle email separately.

5. WordPress - Self-Hosted Email Options

Email included: No (self-hosted WordPress doesn't include email)
Providers: Any - Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, cPanel email, more
Setup: Purchase through hosting provider (cPanel) or separately
Features: Maximum flexibility, hosting providers often include basic email free

üí° Pro tip: Most WordPress hosting includes basic email (5-10 accounts) free via cPanel. This is fine for many small sites. For more features/Gmail interface, add Google Workspace ($6/month). WordPress gives you maximum choice.

SETUP CHECKLIST (Step-by-Step)

Step 1: Choose Your Email Address

Professional format: firstname@yourdomain.com, info@, hello@, contact@
Avoid: admin@ (looks generic), no-reply@ (unprofessional)
Best practice: Use your name for personal brands, info@ or hello@ for businesses

Step 2: Purchase Email Through Your Builder

Squarespace/Wix/Shopify: Buy during website setup (one-click)
Webflow: Buy separately (Google Workspace recommended)
WordPress: Buy through hosting (cPanel) or Google Workspace
Cost: $2-6/month for basic, $6-24/month for Google Workspace

Step 3: Configure DNS Records

MX records: Tell internet where to send your email
SPF records: Prevent spam (verify you're authorized sender)
DKIM records: Sign emails (prevent spoofing)
Most platforms: Auto-configure DNS (one-click setup)

Step 4: Set Up Email Client

Webmail: Access via browser (mail.yourdomain.com)
Desktop: Apple Mail, Outlook, Thunderbird
Mobile: Gmail app, Outlook app, Apple Mail app
Synchronization: Email syncs across all devices automatically

Step 5: Test Your Email

Send test: Email yourself from another account
Test spam filter: Ensure not going to spam folder
Test signature: Create professional email signature
Test on mobile: Ensure phone setup works correctly

EMAIL PROVIDER OPTIONS

SETUP TUTORIALS

Step 1: Choose Your Provider

If you want Gmail: Google Workspace
If you want Outlook: Microsoft 365
If you want budget: Zoho Mail or hosting provider's included email

Step 2: Purchase Email Subscription

Buy directly from provider OR through your website builder/hosting. Same price either way, but buying directly gives you more control.

Step 3: Add DNS Records

Log into your domain registrar (GoDaddy, Namecheap, etc.). Add these records: MX (mail exchange), TXT (SPF verification), CNAME (verification). Provider gives exact values.

Step 4: Verify Domain

Provider checks DNS records (takes 10 minutes to 48 hours). Once verified, you can create email accounts and start sending.

Step 5: Configure SPF/DKIM

CRITICAL for deliverability: Add SPF and DKIM records to prove you're authorized to send from your domain. Provider provides exact records to add.

DELIVERABILITY BEST PRACTICES

PREVENT YOUR EMAILS FROM GOING TO SPAM

SPF RECORD

Sender Policy Framework. Lists authorized IP addresses and domains allowed to send email from your domain. Required for every domain.

DKIM RECORD

DomainKeys Identified Mail. Cryptographic signature proving email wasn't tampered with. Highly recommended for business email.

DMARC RECORD

Domain-based Message Authentication. Tells receiving servers what to do with emails that fail SPF/DKIM. Optional but recommended for large senders.

DELIVERABILITY CHECKLIST:
‚úì Set up SPF record
‚úì Set up DKIM record
‚úì Warm up new domain (send gradually)
‚úì Monitor spam complaints
‚úì Keep engagement high
‚úì Use double opt-in for lists

Reality: Even with perfect SPF/DKIM setup, new domains need warming. Start by sending small amounts (50-100 emails/day) and gradually increase. Most email providers handle this automatically.

EMAIL ALIASES & FORWARDING

COMMON EMAIL ALIASES

Create professional email addresses that all forward to your main inbox:

info@yourdomain.com ‚Üí General inquiries
support@yourdomain.com ‚Üí Customer support
sales@yourdomain.com ‚Üí Sales inquiries
jobs@yourdomain.com ‚Üí Hiring
press@yourdomain.com ‚Üí Media inquiries

FORWARDING SETUP

Most email providers make forwarding easy:

Google Workspace

Admin Console ‚Üí Users ‚Üí Email forwarding

Microsoft 365

Admin Center ‚Üí Users ‚Üí Mail ‚Üí Forwarding

Zoho Mail

Mail Settings ‚Üí Forwarding

PRO TIP: Use "+" addressing for unique tracking. yourname+newsletter@yourdomain.com helps track where spam came from while still delivering to your main inbox.

MIGRATION FROM FREE EMAIL

Step 1: Set Up New Accounts

Create all email accounts you need (info@, support@, individual addresses). Don't disable old Gmail yet - you'll need it for transition.

Step 2: Update Key Services

Change email on: Bank accounts, Social media, Business registrations, Newsletter subscriptions, Client contacts. Start with most important.

Step 3: Import Old Emails

Most providers let you import from Gmail. Google Workspace has built-in import tool. Keep Gmail as backup for 3-6 months during transition.

Step 4: Set Auto-Responder

On old Gmail address, set vacation auto-responder: "My email has changed to you@yourdomain.com - please update your contacts."

Step 5: Forward New Mail

Set Gmail to forward all incoming mail to new address. Do this for 3-6 months to catch anything you missed during service updates.

CUSTOM EMAIL:
BUSINESS CREDIBILITY

Your email address says a lot about your business - you@yourdomain.com looks professional, while @gmail.com looks temporary or unprofessional. Here's what you need to know about custom email for your website.

WHY CUSTOM EMAIL MATTERS

PROFESSIONAL CREDIBILITY

name@yourbusiness.com signals established business. Clients trust businesses with custom email more than free providers. Small investment, big impact on perceived professionalism.

BRAND CONSISTENCY

Email matches your domain name. Reinforces brand with every message sent. Free email providers advertise themselves, not your business.

BETTER DELIVERABILITY

Custom domains have better email deliverability. Business emails less likely to be marked as spam. More reliable for client communication.

SETUP OPTIONS BY PLATFORM

SQUARESPACE: GOOGLE WORKSPACE INTEGRATION

Free professional email included. Google Workspace integration built-in. Easiest setup - just point your domain.

WIX: GOOGLE WORKSPACE OR MICROSOFT 365

Titan plans include email, otherwise third-party. Integration with major email providers. More flexible but potentially more expensive.

WEBFLOW: THIRD-PARTY REQUIRED

No native email - use Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, or Zoho Mail. Most flexible but requires separate setup and billing. Best if you already have email preferences.

QUICK SETUP GUIDE

STEP 1: CHOOSE YOUR EMAIL PROVIDER

Google Workspace ($6/month), Microsoft 365 ($6/month), or Zoho Mail (free/paid). Google Workspace most popular for small businesses.

STEP 2: VERIFY DOMAIN OWNERSHIP

Add DNS records provided by your email host. Usually just adding a TXT record to your domain settings. Platform-specific instructions provided.

STEP 3: CREATE EMAIL ADDRESSES

Set up you@, info@, support@ or other addresses. Create aliases that forward to main inbox if needed. Start using your professional email immediately.

BOTTOM LINE: Custom email is a small investment that delivers significant credibility returns. Most AI builders offer easy integration - don't skip this step. Your email address is often the first impression you make on potential clients.
